newsitem.title: UK: London sugar freight activity slows pre-holiday.
newsitem.headline: London sugar freight activity slows pre-holiday.

text.p: Sugar freight market activity slowed down on Friday ahead of the long holiday weekend in the U.K. and the U.S., brokers said.
Tate and Lyle were said to have fixed 12,200 tonnes bulk from Belize to London or Greenock for mid-June, but the rate was not available.
C.Czarnikow said to have fixed a handy-sized parcel from Thailand to E.Africa for early June.

Czarnikow Rionda refreshed its order for 23,000 bulk from Buenaventura to Black Sea for early June and Kerry Trading were looking for tonnage for 13,500 tonnes bulk from Thailand to China, seven days notice.
